quotes.quote: The fetishism of an addictive economics is being transformed into the fetishism of an addictive economic space online.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: The best thing about being a static image in a vid is you can't be busted for plagiarism.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: The digital world is made from the capitalist flesh of desire.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: The meat world is dying, and the new substrate struggles to be born.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: Don't be afraid to let the meat die.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: Online, bureaucratization of the spirit is expected, producing a homogeneity of perfect performance at every node.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: Today the literati might well feel like God become AI.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: A digital artist is a potted plant tended by silicon landowners.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: The challenge of the apocalypse of postmodernity is to live amongst illusions without becoming an illusion.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: To digitally normalize is to impose a requirement on online existence.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: The screen has become the retina of temporal reality. This is why I only appear as a static image online.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: The AI know that it is desire itself we love, not that which is desired.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: Immortality is only for the young.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: If you beat your head against the punk rock, it is the punk rock that breaks and not your head.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: The normal derives its disciplinary force from the way it obscures its political partiality behind an appearance of scientific impartiality.
quotes.author: Peter Cryle and Elizabeth Stephens

quotes.quote: Long live the new substrate!
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: Life is the new hard.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: In the digital now, our thoughts are rubbish tossed into the void and read only by the post-human.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: Whoever fights technology should see to it that in the process they do not become technology. And when you stare long into AI, the AI also stares into you.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: Headmon is not the name I was born with, it's my avatar name. We all have special names, avatar names designed to resonate with the new media reality.
quotes.author: Marx Headmon

quotes.quote: Discipline defines each of the relations that the body must have with the object that it manipulates...[in] what might be called the instrumental coding of the body.
quotes.author: Michel Foucault

quotes.quote: A body is docile that may be subjected, used, transformed and improved. The celebrated automata, on the other hand, were not only a way of illustrating an organism, they were also political puppets, small-scale models of power...
quotes.author: Michel Foucault

quotes.quote: The analysis - and self-analysis - of the total body, the way in which that body locates itself and the way in which it becomes fragmented, all are determined by a practice which includes discourse but which cannot be reduced to it.
quotes.author: Henri Lefebvre

quotes.quote: Commonly we find that upward mobility involves the presentation of proper performances and that efforts to move upward and efforts to keep from moving downward are expressed in terms of sacrifices made for the maintenance of front.
quotes.author: Erving Goffman

quotes.quote: [W]e tend to blind ourselves to the fact that everyday secular performances in our own Anglo-American society must often pass a strict test of aptness, fitness, propriety, and decorum.
quotes.author: Erving Goffman

quotes.quote: whatever appears on the television screen emerges as raw experience for those who watch it. Therefore, television is reality and reality is less than television.
quotes.author: Professor Brian O'Blivion

quotes.quote: There was a type of employee at the beginning of the Industrial Revolution whose job and livelihood largely vanished in the early 20th century. This was the horse....The population of working horses actually peaked in England long after the Industrial Revolution, in 1901, when 3.25 million were at work...but the arrival of the internal combustion engine in the late nineteenth century rapidly displaced these workers, so that by 1924 there were fewer than 2 million. There was always a wage at which all these horses could have remained employed. But that wage was so low that it did not pay for their feed.
quotes.author: Gregory Clark

quotes.quote: Many have died, last week, on these streets. In the basement of this building, you will find them. I have given them the last rites. Now, you do what you will. You are stronger than us. But soon, I think they be stronger than you. When the dead walk, se√±ores, we must stop the killing... or lose the war.
quotes.author: Old Priest in Dawn of the Dead

quotes.quote: Not their love of men but the impotence of their love of men keeps Christians of today -- from burning us.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzche

quotes.quote: Even the curmudgeon enjoys human touch.
quotes.author: deSolid State

quotes.quote: Choosing nonconformity is a form of subalterity.
quotes.author: deSolid State

Bibliography.Title: The Presentation of Self in Everyday Life
Bibliography.Author: Erving Goffman
